newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE coffee firmer on trade, industry buying.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE coffee firmer on trade, industry buying.

text.p: Robusta coffee futures resumed a gentle upward trend on Wednesday morning with nearby prices driven by trade and industry buying against a backdrop of perceived ample supply.
The September/November spread attracted steady interest, which boosted the overall turnover, moving to a discount of around $3 after standing at an $8 premium at the start of Tuesday.
Traders said they were slightly surprised by the movement in the spread as more of a squeeze had been expected on spot September.
"We thought it (Sept/Nov) was going to go the other way...but I wouldn't say it (the market) is moving in a dramatic fashion," said one.
Some buying was also seen from London brokers acting for the European trade, market sources said.
At the midday break September was up $9 at $1,665 and November up $14 at $1,669. Volume reached 2,058 lots.
Traders said the London market still had good availability of hedgeable robusta coffee.
Supply was ample due to coffees which did not re-grade under the exchange's new criteria, in effect from the July delivery period, they said.
But more liquidity was still needed in the further forwards to encourage higher volume from nearby October which could be rolled.
